data.description:

Galaxy Entertainment Group ( (HK:0027) ) has shared an update.

Galaxy Entertainment Group has declared a final ordinary dividend of HKD 0.8 per share for the financial year ended 31 December 2025, underscoring the company’s continued capacity to return cash to shareholders. The dividend, subject to shareholder approval on 12 May 2026, signals management’s confidence in the group’s earnings and cash flow profile for the period.

The shares will trade ex-dividend on 22 May 2026, with the record date set for 29 May 2026 to determine eligible shareholders. Payment of the final dividend is scheduled for 12 June 2026, providing a defined timetable for investors planning around income distributions from the stock.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0027) stock is a Buy with a HK$44.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Galaxy Entertainment Group stock, see the HK:0027 Stock Forecast page.

More about Galaxy Entertainment Group

Galaxy Entertainment Group Limited is a Hong Kong-listed company operating in the gaming and entertainment industry. It focuses on casino and resort operations in Macau, targeting both mass-market and premium gaming customers, and is a key player in the region’s integrated resort and leisure market.

data.description:

The latest update is out from Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing ( (HK:0388) ).

Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited has declared a second interim ordinary dividend of HK$6.52 per share for the financial year ending 31 December 2025, with payment scheduled for 25 March 2026. The dividend will be paid in Hong Kong dollars, with the shares trading ex-dividend on 11 March 2026 and a record date of 16 March 2026, following a brief book closure period to determine shareholder entitlements.

The announcement underlines HKEX’s continued practice of returning cash to shareholders on a semi-annual basis, reflecting confidence in its earnings capacity and cash generation as the operator of Hong Kong’s key securities and derivatives markets. The board composition remains dominated by independent non-executive directors alongside a single executive director who also serves as chief executive, reinforcing a governance framework that is closely watched by investors in a systemically important market infrastructure group.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0388) stock is a Buy with a HK$550.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing stock, see the HK:0388 Stock Forecast page.

More about Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing

Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited (HKEX) operates Hong Kong’s stock and derivatives exchanges and related clearing houses, serving as a central market operator and infrastructure provider for regional and international investors. The group’s core services span securities listing, trading, and post-trade clearing and settlement, positioning it as a key gateway for capital flows into and out of mainland China.

data.title: Galaxy Entertainment lifts earnings as Macau recovery, premium push and events strategy gain pace
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Galaxy Entertainment Group ( (HK:0027) ) has provided an announcement.

Galaxy Entertainment Group reported continued momentum in Macau’s post-pandemic recovery, with the territory’s Gross Gaming Revenue rising 9% in 2025 and visitation hitting a record 40.1 million, driven by eased mainland travel policies and rising international arrivals. The company sharpened its focus on premium and super-premium mass segments, supported by the soft launch and February 2026 opening of ultra-luxury Capella, to strengthen its position in high-value customer tiers.

Financially, the group lifted adjusted EBITDA 19% to HK$14.5 billion and net profit attributable to shareholders 22% to HK$10.7 billion, underpinned by a HK$36.3 billion cash pile that supports dividends, development, and potential overseas expansion. Management highlighted the success of the Galaxy Arena and convention center, which hosted about 350 concerts, sports and major events in 2025, reinforcing Macau’s non-gaming appeal and driving incremental resort revenue.

The company is aligning closely with Macau’s push to diversify beyond gaming, backing the city’s ambitions as a hub for performing arts and sports and renewing partnerships with global entertainment and ticketing platforms. Following the closure of Waldo Casino in October 2025, Galaxy pledged to safeguard local employment by retaining staff or offering new career paths, while accelerating Phase 4 development and expanding non-gaming offerings in 2026 to consolidate its role in Macau’s transformation into a world tourism and leisure center.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0027) stock is a Buy with a HK$44.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Galaxy Entertainment Group stock, see the HK:0027 Stock Forecast page.

More about Galaxy Entertainment Group

Galaxy Entertainment Group is a Hong Kong–incorporated gaming and hospitality operator focused on Macau’s integrated resort market. The group runs large-scale casino resorts with hotels, retail, entertainment, and convention facilities, targeting premium and super-premium mass gaming customers as well as a growing base of international visitors across Asia.

Average Trading Volume: 9,725,439

Technical Sentiment Signal: Buy

Current Market Cap: HK$187.4B

data.title: DL Holdings Wins Key SFC Nod to Advance Tokenisation of DL Tower and Animoca Funds
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

DL Holdings Group Limited ( (HK:1709) ) has shared an update.

DL Holdings Group Limited has secured a key regulatory green light in Hong Kong for its real-world asset tokenisation strategy, after the Securities and Futures Commission indicated it had no further comments on business plans submitted by DL Securities (HK) Limited and DL Digital Family Office (HK) Limited. These plans cover the tokenisation and distribution of interests in fund products linked to DL Tower, a commercial property in Central, and an Animoca Brands investment, aimed at eligible professional investors.

The development marks a significant milestone for the Group’s push into tokenised securities, signalling regulatory validation of its approach and reinforcing its positioning within Hong Kong’s evolving digital asset framework. DL Securities will now build the operational infrastructure and onboarding processes for distributing the tokenised fund interests, while DL Digital Family Office will implement blockchain-based representation of fund units under its asset management licence, with Asseto Fintech handling token issuance on the HashKey Chain and XRP Ledger.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:1709) stock is a Buy with a HK$1.50 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on DL Holdings Group Limited stock, see the HK:1709 Stock Forecast page.

More about DL Holdings Group Limited

DL Holdings Group Limited is a Hong Kong-based financial services group operating through subsidiaries including DL Securities (HK) Limited and DL Digital Family Office (HK) Limited. The Group focuses on asset management, securities distribution and innovative digital-asset solutions, with a growing emphasis on real-world asset tokenisation for professional investors in regulated markets.

data.title: HKEX Posts Record 2025, Regains Top Global IPO Spot and Expands Product Ecosystem
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing ( (HK:0388) ) has provided an announcement.

Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing reported record trading and financial performance for 2025, regaining its status as the world’s leading IPO venue and advancing an extensive reform and product development agenda. The group highlighted its role in channelling global capital into Asian and Chinese assets, while continuing to modernise its infrastructure and support Hong Kong’s position as a global financial hub amid expectations of continued market volatility.

Operationally, HKEX marked its 25th listing anniversary, committed to permanent headquarters premises, expanded its international footprint with a Dubai subsidiary for commodities pricing, and completed the purchase of a 20 per cent stake in CMU OmniClear. It also deepened ties with regional exchanges, including Thailand and Abu Dhabi, and enhanced its regulatory framework with new IPO price discovery rules and updated ongoing public float requirements effective from 2026.

On the product side, HKEX broadened its multi-asset ecosystem with a series of firsts in Asia, including single-stock leveraged and inverse products, Saudi Sukuk and Solana ETFs, and new biotech and technology indices. Enhancements to OTC Clear and Bond Connect, along with extended Swap Connect tenors and expanded short-dated options, underscore HKEX’s strategy to offer more sophisticated risk management tools and attract diversified global capital into Hong Kong’s markets.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0388) stock is a Buy with a HK$550.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing stock, see the HK:0388 Stock Forecast page.

More about Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing

Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited (HKEX) is Hong Kong’s listed exchange operator, running equities, derivatives and fixed income markets, and positioning itself as a global “superconnector” between Asian, particularly Chinese, capital and international investors. The group focuses on multi-asset trading, clearing and market infrastructure, expanding into commodities pricing, ETFs, and structured products to strengthen Hong Kong’s role as an international financial centre.

Average Trading Volume: 4,307,856

Technical Sentiment Signal: Buy

Current Market Cap: HK$523.4B

data.title: Jiu Rong Advances Asset Sales and Refinancing to Address Going-Concern Audit Disclaimer
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Jiu Rong Holdings Limited ( (HK:2358) ) has shared an update.

Jiu Rong Holdings has issued a quarterly update on its action plan to address a disclaimer of opinion from its auditor, which raised material uncertainties about the Group’s ability to continue as a going concern. The company is pursuing asset disposals, creditor negotiations, and refinancing initiatives to shore up liquidity and mitigate these concerns.

To relieve cash pressure, the Group has completed the sale of 11 bus charging stations in Hangzhou, with shareholder approval obtained and asset handover under way, which is expected to bolster working capital. Management is also in active talks with its major creditor, Westlake Electronics, and key suppliers on extensions, interest reductions, and debt-to-asset swaps, while having secured renewals and extensions on about RMB82.3 million of interest-bearing borrowings, signalling incremental progress in stabilising its financial position.

More about Jiu Rong Holdings Limited

Jiu Rong Holdings Limited is a Hong Kong-listed company incorporated in the Cayman Islands, operating through a group structure that includes assets such as new energy bus charging stations and investment properties in mainland China. The Group relies on bank borrowings and supplier credit, making liquidity management and refinancing crucial to sustaining its ongoing operations and meeting financial obligations.

data.title: CK Hutchison Group to Exit UK Power Networks in Major Disposal
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

CK Hutchison Holdings ( (HK:0001) ) just unveiled an announcement.

CK Hutchison Holdings and CK Infrastructure Holdings have agreed, alongside related group entities, to sell their combined 100% stake in UK Power Networks, a leading electricity distribution network operator in the United Kingdom. The deal, executed through a share purchase agreement, will see CKI, PAH and CKA divest their respective 40%, 40% and 20% interests, including associated shareholder debt instruments.

The disposal is intended to monetise a long‑held UK infrastructure investment at what CKI’s board considers an attractive valuation, crystallising significant accounting gains and freeing cash for future investments or acquisitions. The transaction is classified as a major and connected transaction for CKI and a discloseable and connected transaction for CK Hutchison under Hong Kong listing rules, requiring announcements, circulars and independent shareholders’ approvals, and it remains subject to conditions, meaning completion is not yet guaranteed.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0001) stock is a Hold with a HK$67.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on CK Hutchison Holdings stock, see the HK:0001 Stock Forecast page.

More about CK Hutchison Holdings

CK Hutchison Holdings is a Hong Kong-based conglomerate with diversified interests spanning infrastructure, utilities, ports, retail, and telecommunications. Through its subsidiary CK Infrastructure Holdings, the group has built a substantial portfolio of regulated infrastructure assets, including electricity distribution networks, primarily in Europe and other mature markets.

Powerlong Real Estate Holdings Ltd., a Cayman Islands-incorporated property developer listed in Hong Kong, operates primarily through its Shanghai and Hong Kong offices. The group is chaired by founder Hoi Kin Hong and governed by a mix of executive, non-executive and independent non-executive directors, consistent with Hong Kong corporate governance practices.

The company has called an extraordinary general meeting for 18 March 2026 in Shanghai for shareholders to vote on approving and ratifying a specific agreement and its related transactions. If endorsed, the resolution will give directors broad authority to implement the agreement, execute associated documents and make variations they deem in the company’s interests, signaling a potentially significant transaction that could influence Powerlong’s strategic and operational plans.

The notice also outlines procedural details for shareholder participation, including proxy appointments, joint holder voting rules and the closure of the share register from 13 to 18 March 2026, with a record date matching the meeting date. These arrangements ensure only registered shareholders as of that date can attend and vote, underscoring the importance of the resolution for investors with a stake in the company’s future direction.

HSBC Holdings plc has announced that its Annual Report and Accounts for the year ended 31 December 2025 has been submitted to the UK National Storage Mechanism for regulatory inspection. data.title: Court clears path for Minmetals Land privatisation and Hong Kong delisting
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

The latest announcement is out from Minmetals Land Limited ( (HK:0230) ).

Minmetals Land Limited and its controlling shareholder June Glory International Limited have moved a step closer to taking the property developer private, after a Bermuda court sanctioned their scheme of arrangement on 25 February 2026. The proposal, which will see all shares acquired by the offeror, remains subject to remaining conditions being fulfilled or waived, but the parties report no known impediments to completion.

Once the outstanding conditions are met, the scheme is expected to become effective on 27 February 2026, at which point it will be binding on all shareholders under Bermuda law. The company’s shares are then slated to be delisted from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange at 4:00 p.m. on 3 March 2026, marking Minmetals Land’s exit from the public market and ending public trading in its stock.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:0230) stock is a Hold with a HK$1.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Minmetals Land Limited stock, see the HK:0230 Stock Forecast page.

More about Minmetals Land Limited

Minmetals Land Limited is a Bermuda-incorporated company listed in Hong Kong and engaged in the property sector, operating under the wider Minmetals group ecosystem. Its shares trade on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange under stock code 230, providing investors exposure to its real estate and related development activities in Greater China and beyond.

data.description:

An announcement from Seazen Group Ltd. ( (HK:1030) ) is now available.

Seazen Group Limited said its subsidiary New Metro Global Limited plans an international offering of U.S. dollar-denominated guaranteed senior notes, with the notes to be guaranteed by the parent. Pricing, including size, offer price and coupon, will be set via a bookbuilding led by Citigroup Global Markets and Haitong International Securities as joint global coordinators and bookrunners.

The issuer and Seazen intend to use net proceeds to fund a concurrent 2026 offer to purchase, refinance existing debt and for general corporate purposes, as part of ongoing balance-sheet management. The notes have received in-principle approval for listing on the Singapore Exchange, though no Hong Kong listing is sought, and the company cautioned that no binding agreement has yet been signed so the deal may not proceed.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:1030) stock is a Hold with a HK$2.50 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on Seazen Group Ltd. stock, see the HK:1030 Stock Forecast page.

More about Seazen Group Ltd.

Seazen Group Limited, incorporated in the Cayman Islands and listed in Hong Kong, operates in the property development and investment sector. Through subsidiaries such as New Metro Global Limited, the group taps international capital markets to support refinancing, liability management and broader corporate funding needs.

data.title: CKI and CK Hutchison Move to Monetise UK Power Networks Stake in Major Disposal
data.description:
Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

CK Infrastructure Holdings ( (HK:1038) ) has issued an update.

CK Infrastructure Holdings and CK Hutchison Holdings have agreed to sell their combined 100% stake in UK Power Networks via a share purchase agreement involving CKI Sub, PAH Sub, CKA Sub and a third-party purchaser. The transaction will dispose of all shares and related shareholder debt instruments in the UK electricity distribution operator, monetising a long-held asset that has delivered steady growth and financial contributions since CKI’s initial investment in 2010.

CKI’s portion of the disposal qualifies as a major and connected transaction under Hong Kong Listing Rules, triggering requirements for announcements, circulars and independent shareholders’ approval. For CK Hutchison, the deal is treated as a discloseable and connected transaction, requiring disclosure and independent approval, while completion remains conditional on agreed terms, meaning the sale may not ultimately proceed and investors are urged to exercise caution.

The most recent analyst rating on (HK:1038) stock is a Hold with a HK$70.00 price target. To see the full list of analyst forecasts on CK Infrastructure Holdings stock, see the HK:1038 Stock Forecast page.

More about CK Infrastructure Holdings

CK Infrastructure Holdings is a Hong Kong-listed infrastructure investment company focused on energy, transportation and utility assets worldwide. Through subsidiaries and affiliates, it invests in and operates regulated infrastructure businesses, including electricity distribution networks such as UK Power Networks, providing stable cash flows and long-term returns for shareholders.
